intro: Narcissus assoanus subsp. rivas-martinezii, commonly known as the Rivas Martinez narcissus, is a rare and flowering plant native to southern Spain. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant prefers rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in Mediterranean scrub habitats. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
